required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Anesthetic Agents on Optic Nerve Sheath Diameter
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Anesthetic Agents (Propofol, Sevoflurane) on Optic Nerve Sheath Diameter(ONSD) in Patients Undergoing Robot-assisted Laparoscopic Gynecology Surgery

lead_sponsor.agency: Hallym University Kangnam Sacred Heart Hospital

clinical_study.source: Hallym University Kangnam Sacred Heart Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: The present study is to evaluate the effect of anesthetic agents ( propofol , sevoflurane) on intracranial pressure of female patients undergoing laparoscopic-robotic surgery.

detailed_description.textblock:
Anesthetic agents (propofol and sevoflurane)have different effect on intracranial pressure. Sevoflurane when used over 0.5 minimum alveolar concentration, dilates intracranial vasculature and increases intracranial pressure. On the other hand, propofol decreases intracranial blood pressure and intracranial pressure is maintained or decreases.
Optic nerve sheath diameter is a feasible diagnostic tool in evaluating intracranial pressure. Female patients undergoing robot-assisted laparoscopic hysterectomy or myomectomy are evaluated.

primary_outcome.measure: difference of optic nerve sheath diameter
primary_outcome.description: optic nerve sheath diameter is measured using sonographic probe. (10 minutes after induction of anesthesia/ 5 minutes after pneumoperitoneum and trendelenburg position / 20 minutes after pneumoperitoneum and trendelenburg position / 40 minutes after pneumoperitoneum and trendelenburg position / skin closure)

arm_group.description: 1.5-2.5 vol% of sevoflurane is used for maintenance of anesthesia.
2-5 mcg/ml of propofol is used continuously for maintenance of anesthesia using target-controlled infusion system.

intervention.description: 1.5-2.5 vol % sevoflurane is used for maintenance of anesthesia.
2-5 mcg/ml of propofol is used for maintenance of anesthesia.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- female patients undergoing robot-assisted laparoscopic hysterectomy or myomectomy
Exclusion Criteria:
- history of brain hemorrhage or brain infarction
- liver disease or end stage renal disease
- glaucoma or any signs of increased intraocular pressure
- combined wtih other types of operation
- patient refusal
- weight less than 40 kg or over 100 kg
